text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Nicosia and Athens are calm in the face of Turkish threats to knock out the S-300 missile system.
- Small whirlwind causes widespread damage to villages on the southeastern coast.
- Strict rationing of water supplies starts as drought continues.
- Ankara threatens attack on missile launchers. The United States warns Turkey.
- Discussions on the defence fund budget start in parliament.
- "Biblical" damage reported as storm hits coast.
- Deregulation of interest rates will drive them up, the communist party Akel say.
- The United States issues a strict warning to Turkey not to attack Cyprus. Nicosia and Athens lower their tones over the affair.
- The government seeks a 10 percent reduction in import duty for goods from the European Union.
- The Attila (Turkish occupation army) is growing bold. Greece says it will not play Turkey's game to treat Ankara's usual threats as a Greco-Turkish crisis.
